item.title: Atul Subhash's Mother Goes To Supreme Court For 4-Year-Old Grandson's Custody - NDTV
item.description:
Atul Subhash's Mother Goes To Supreme Court For 4-Year-Old Grandson's Custody

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

In a poignant development, the mother of Atul Subhash, a Bengaluru engineer who died by suicide, has approached the Supreme Court for custody of her four-year-old grandson amidst allegations of harassment against Subhash's estranged wife and her family.

  • The case revolves around multiple arrests linked to Subhash's suicide on December 9, which his family claims was prompted by harassment.
  • Anju Modi filed a habeas corpus petition for her grandson, whose whereabouts remain unknown despite claims he is in a boarding school.
  • The Supreme Court has asked the governments of Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, and Karnataka for clarity regarding the child’s location.
  • Nikita Singhania, Subhash's estranged wife, and her family members face charges related to abetment of suicide and are currently in custody.
  • Pawan Kumar, Subhash's father, demands to know the child's whereabouts and custody due to the family's concerns for his safety.
  • There is ongoing legal contention, including anticipatory bail requests concerning Nikita's uncle.
Bikas Kumar, Subhash's brother, stated, "Our fight will continue. We will not immerse the ashes of my brother till we get justice."

The situation highlights serious familial disputes and legal battles regarding the welfare of a young child amidst tragic circumstances.

item.title: FIR filed against CT Ravi, will be presented before court: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara - Hindustan Times
item.description:
FIR Filed Against BJP Leader CT Ravi Over Allegations of Derogatory Remarks

Date: Dec 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara announced that an FIR has been filed against BJP leader CT Ravi after he allegedly made derogatory remarks towards Congress Leader Laxmi Hebbalkar. Ravi is set to be presented before the court following these accusations.

  • An FIR was filed against CT Ravi after he allegedly used obscene language towards Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar.
  • G Parameshwara affirmed that CT Ravi will be presented in court today.
  • The incident escalated after CT Ravi reportedly called Rahul Gandhi a drug addict.
  • Advocate MB Jiragi claimed that formal arrest procedures were not followed for CT Ravi.
“This incident all started after he allegedly called Rahul Gandhi a drug addict. It is wrong, being a senior politician no one should use such words, that too against a lady who is a minister.”

This situation raises concerns regarding the treatment of political figures and the respect accorded to political discourse in Karnataka.

item.title: Allahabad High Court grants interim protection from arrest to Mohammed Zubair - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Allahabad High Court Grants Interim Protection to Journalist Mohammed Zubair

Published on: 20 Dec 2024, 9:01 am

The Allahabad High Court has granted interim protection from arrest to Alt News journalist Mohammed Zubair, who was charged by the Uttar Pradesh Police for allegedly endangering national integrity through a critical tweet about a controversial priest's speech.

  • Zubair's arrest was temporarily blocked until a court hearing scheduled for January 6, 2025.
  • He tweeted that a speech by priest Yati Narsinghanand was derogatory and hateful, leading to accusations against him.
  • The FIR against Zubair was lodged following a complaint from the priest's supporters.
  • Zubair claims the charges are a retaliation for exposing Narsinghanand's hateful remarks.
  • The case has drawn significant attention, reflective of ongoing tensions regarding freedom of speech and communal relations in India.
Zubair stated that the FIR against him is a malicious attempt to prevent him from exposing criminal activities.

This interim ruling highlights the ongoing conflict between journalists and political or religious figures in India, particularly regarding freedom of expression and the safety of reporting on sensitive issues.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 21 Live Updates: On last day of Winter Session, both Houses adjourned ‘sine die’ amid Centre-Oppn uproar - The Indian Express
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Day 21 Live Updates: On last day of Winter Session, both Houses adjourned ‘sine die’ amid Centre-Oppn uproar

Date & Source: December 21, 2024 | Indian Express

On the final day of the Winter Session of Parliament, both Houses were adjourned sine die shortly after reconvening amidst a faceoff between the Centre and Opposition MPs, related to protests over comments made about B R Ambedkar.

  • The Lok Sabha adopted a resolution referring bills on simultaneous elections to a joint parliamentary committee.
  • Protests in Parliament led to a scuffle involving Opposition and BJP MPs.
  • Two BJP MPs were reportedly injured during the confrontations.
“In a decisive move aimed at maintaining decorum, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla issued instructions that no political party or groups of MPs will be allowed to hold any protest at the gates of Parliament House.”

This session's conclusion highlights ongoing tensions between political parties in India, particularly concerning the treatment of historical figures like Dr B R Ambedkar.

item.title: Parliament winter session comes to end amid BJP-INDIA bloc showdown - The Times of India
item.description:
Parliament winter session comes to end amid BJP-INDIA bloc showdown

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The winter session of Parliament has concluded, marked by intense confrontations between the ruling BJP and the opposition INDIA bloc. The session saw significant debates and discussions surrounding various key issues.

  • The winter session addressed multiple legislative measures amidst ongoing political tensions.
  • Opposition parties criticized the BJP for its handling of crucial topics, raising questions about governance.
  • Key debates revolved around economic policies, social issues, and national security.
“The essence of democracy is the ability to debate and discuss,” stated a senior opposition leader during the sessions.

The conclusion of this winter session reflects the polarized political landscape in India, with implications for future legislative actions and political strategies.

item.title: 'Communal conflicts not right if becoming leader is only goal,' Ayodhya Ram Mandir chief priest backs RSS head Mohan Bhagwat - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Communal conflicts not right if becoming leader is only goal,' Ayodhya Ram Mandir chief priest backs RSS head Mohan Bhagwat

Published: 20 December 2024, Source: ANI

Chief Priest of Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Temple, Acharya Satyendra Das, emphasized that communal conflicts are unjustifiable if driven solely by the desire for leadership, aligning his views with RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat’s concerns over rising communal tensions.

  • Acharya Satyendra Das criticized those who incite conflicts for personal gain.
  • Mohan Bhagwat expressed worries about the rise of temple-mosque disputes.
  • He advocated for inclusivity and harmony in Indian society during a recent lecture.
“...The conflict of a temple and a mosque is a communal conflict. And as such conflicts are rising, few people are becoming leaders...” - Acharya Satyendra Das

This discourse highlights the ongoing tensions around communal identity and leadership in contemporary Indian society.

item.title: Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala passes away in Gurugram - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala passes away in Gurugram

Date: December 20, 2024

Source: HT News Desk

Om Prakash Chautala, the former chief minister of Haryana and Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) supremo, passed away at the age of 89 due to a cardiac arrest.

  • Chautala was last seen publicly during Haryana's Assembly elections held on October 5, 2024.
  • He was the son of former Deputy Prime Minister Chaudhary Devi Lal and served as Haryana's chief minister multiple times.
  • Chautala had a controversial political career, including jail time related to a disproportionate assets case.
  • He is survived by three daughters and two sons, with notable political figures in his family.
“Om Prakash Chautala was a prominent political figure whose career encompassed significant controversies and achievements.”

His passing marks the end of an era in Haryana politics, reflective of his father’s legacy and his lengthy career.

item.title: Former Haryana CM and INLD chief OP Chautala passes away at 89 - The Times of India
item.description:
Former Haryana CM and INLD chief OP Chautala passes away at 89

Date: Not provided
Source: Not provided

OP Chautala, a prominent political figure in Haryana and the Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) chief, has passed away at the age of 89.

  • Chautala was known for his impactful political career and leadership in the state.
  • His contributions to Haryana's political landscape were significant.
  • He served multiple terms as Chief Minister and was influential in various policy decisions.
“His leadership will be missed in Haryana politics.”

The news of his passing has brought a wave of condolences from across the political spectrum, highlighting his legacy.

item.title: Kalyan attack on Marathi family dominates Maharashtra's Nagpur winter session - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Kalyan Attack on Marathi Family Sparks Political Outrage in Maharashtra

Date: 20 December 2024, Source: Deccan Herald

The recent attack on a Marathi family in Kalyan has become a significant political issue, highlighted by opposition leaders during Maharashtra's winter session in Nagpur.

  • The incident took place at Ajmera Heights in Kalyan, near Mumbai.
  • Akhilesh Shukla, an Accounts Manager, allegedly summoned goons to attack his Marathi neighbor, Abhijit Deshmukh.
  • A dispute arose over the lighting of incense sticks, leading to Shukla's derogatory remarks against the Marathi community.
  • Despite a police complaint, no action was taken against Shukla, spurring outrage among local leaders.
  • Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar called for a serious probe into the incident.
  • The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena warned of repercussions if Shukla is not arrested promptly.
“This is serious. There should be a probe,” - Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.
“How can you interfere in someone's personal choices?” - Aaditya Thackeray.

This incident highlights ongoing tensions within the community and raises questions about law enforcement's response to such matters.

item.title: 52 kg gold, Rs 10 crore cash seized by IT linked to Lokayukta raid on ex-RTO constable and associate - The Times of India
item.description:
52 kg gold, Rs 10 crore cash seized by IT linked to Lokayukta raid on ex-RTO constable and associate

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a significant operation, the Indian Tax authorities seized 52 kg of gold and Rs 10 crore in cash linked to a Lokayukta raid involving a former RTO constable and his associate.

  • Seizure includes 52 kg of gold.
  • Cash amounting to Rs 10 crore was also confiscated.
  • The operation is linked to allegations against a former RTO constable.
“This operation highlights the ongoing efforts to combat corruption and illegal wealth accumulation.”

The raid marks a critical step in addressing corruption within public services.

item.title: Parliament LIVE | Lok Sabha adjourned sine die; RS proceedings under way - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Parliament LIVE | Stormy Winter Session Ends with Both Houses Adjourned Sine Die

Published on: 20 December 2024, 03:02 IST

The Winter Session of Parliament concluded with both the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha adjourned sine die amidst protests and controversies, including issues around B R Ambedkar and the introduction of a joint committee to examine election bills.

  • Lok Sabha adjourned amid protests from opposition and treasury benches.
  • Speaker Om Birla directed members against demonstrations at Parliament gates.
  • Resolution for a joint committee on 'one nation, one election' was presented.
  • Rajya Sabha also adjourned sine die, reflecting on session productivity of 40.03%.
  • Opposition leaders boycotted a customary meeting with the Speaker.
“As we conclude the session, coinciding with the 75th anniversary of our constitution, we face a moment of serious reflection.”

This session has been marked by significant tensions and the clear divide between the ruling and opposition parties.

item.title: Supreme Court upholds decision to scrap toll collection on DND Flyway - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Supreme Court Upholds Decision to Scrap Toll Collection on DND Flyway

Date: Dec 20, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a major relief for commuters using the Delhi-Noida Direct (DND) flyway, the Supreme Court has upheld a decision barring the collection of toll charges, reprimanding the Noida Authority for allowing a toll company to exploit commuters indefinitely.

  • The Supreme Court confirmed the Allahabad High Court's 2016 ruling against toll collection by the Noida Toll Bridge Company Ltd (NTBCL).
  • The court found that NTBCL had already recovered the costs and profits since the expressway opened in 2001.
  • Justice Kant criticized the Noida Authority for not defining a time frame for toll collection, leading to indefinite charges on users.
  • The court validated a public interest litigation filed against NTBCL's toll collection practices.
  • Prior to this ruling, commuters were paying ₹28 per trip or ₹56 for round trips.
“NOIDA overstepped its authority by delegating powers to NTBCL to collect or levy fees, resulting in undue burden on users,” - Justice Surya Kant.

The verdict is expected to alleviate the financial burden on thousands of daily commuters, promoting fairness in public infrastructure projects.

item.title: DND flyway to remain toll-free; Supreme Court dismisses appeal against HC order - The Times of India
item.description:
DND flyway to remain toll-free; Supreme Court dismisses appeal against HC order

Date: [Publication Date] Source: [Source]

The Supreme Court has upheld a decision by the High Court, ensuring that the DND flyway will remain toll-free. This decision is significant for commuters in the region.

  • The Supreme Court dismissed an appeal regarding the toll status of the DND flyway.
  • This ruling is expected to benefit daily commuters traveling via this route.
  • The decision reinforces the earlier High Court verdict regarding tolls on the DND flyway.
This decision is a victory for the residents and commuters of the area.

In conclusion, the ruling by the Supreme Court marks a vital moment for traffic regulation and public accessibility in the region.

item.title: Seven dead, many injured in massive LPG tanker explosion on Jaipur-Ajmer Highway, 40 vehicles burnt - India TV News
item.description:
Eight Dead in Massive LPG Tanker Explosion on Jaipur-Ajmer Highway

Date: Recent Incident
Source: India TV News

A tragic LPG tanker explosion on the Jaipur-Ajmer Highway resulted in eight fatalities and numerous injuries. The incident caused extensive damage, engulfing approximately 40 vehicles in flames.

  • The explosion occurred early Friday morning after a collision between an LPG tanker and a truck.
  • 39 individuals received treatment at SMS Hospital for severe burn injuries.
  • Over 20 fire engines responded to the scene to control the blaze.
  • The Rajasthan Chief Minister visited the injured at the hospital and expressed condolences on social media.
  • Rescue operations successfully saved people trapped in their vehicles, including a passenger bus.
“Deeply saddened to hear the news of casualties in the gas tanker fire incident on the Jaipur-Ajmer National Highway.” - CM Bhajanlal Sharma

This devastating incident highlights the dangers associated with transporting hazardous materials and the urgent need for safety measures.

item.title: After Dwarka DPS In Delhi, Noida School Gets Bomb Threat On Same Day - ABP Live
item.description:
Noida School Faces Bomb Threat Following Incident at DPS Dwarka

Published at: 20 Dec 2024 10:39 AM (IST) | Source: ABP Live

The alarming trend of bomb threats continues in the Delhi-NCR region as Lotus Valley International School in Noida received a threat on the same day DPS Dwarka did.

  • The school was evacuated immediately after the bomb threat was reported.
  • Noida Police conducted an investigation at the school premises.
  • This incident marked the sixth bomb threat to schools in the region in just two weeks.
  • Political commentary highlighted concerns regarding safety measures and police response to these threats.
“Morale of criminals is high because no one has been caught yet for issuing such threats.” — Arvind Kejriwal

The situation emphasizes the ongoing concerns regarding school safety in the region, which continues to be under threat.

item.title: Karnataka Deputy CM Shivakumar rules out any interference in police action against BJP leader Ravi - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Karnataka Deputy CM Shivakumar Comments on Police Action Against BJP Leader

Date: 20 December 2024 Source: Deccan Herald

Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar stated that there will be no interference in the police action against BJP leader C T Ravi, who was arrested for allegedly using derogatory language against Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar.

  • Shivakumar referred to Ravi as having a "filthy mouth" and criticized his past behavior.
  • Ravi has accused the police of violating his human rights after being taken on rounds following his arrest.
  • Shivakumar commented on BJP leaders meeting Ravi at the police station, questioning the appropriateness of such a meeting.
  • A case was registered against Ravi under sections related to sexual harassment and insult to modesty based on a complaint by Minister Hebbalkar.
  • Shivakumar offered to release audio or video evidence of the incident if the media did not possess it.
“This is not new for him (Ravi). He had used words against several people in the past...” – D K Shivakumar

This incident highlights the tensions between political parties in Karnataka, particularly regarding the use of language and accountability among public officials.
